Michigan Ongoing Health & Safety Training Part B

About This Course

It is the responsibility of all child care providers working in licensed programs (child care centers or homes) to be familiar with and adhere to all licensing rules related to the topics discussed in this training.

Learning Objectives

CHILD CARE PROVIDERS WILL CAPTURE A RENEWED KNOWLEDGE OF:

  • Administration of Medications
  • Prevention & Control of Infectious Disease, including Immunizations
  • Prevention and Response to Emergencies Due to Food & Allergic Reactions
  • Handling & Storage of Hazardous Materials & Appropriate Disposal of Bio-contaminants

Course Outline

Section 1:
Administration of Medications

Section 2:
Prevention & Response to Emergencies Due to Food & Allergic Reactions

Section 3:
Prevention & Control of Infectious Disease (Including Immunizations)

Section 4:
Handling & Storage of Hazardous Materials & Appropriate Disposal of Bio-Contaminents

Grading

To receive full completion for this course, you'll need to view all of the pages, finish all of the activities, and make at least one post in each discussion board. You can check your grades at any time by going to Course Links at the top of the course and selecting "Grades" from the drop down options.

Facilitation

This course is an open entry and open exit course. While the course is not facilitated, there are education services specialist from the United States Military who are able to access the course. They may reach out, and are available for contact, to offer you support. They also may participate in discussions on an infrequent basis.

The grading and feedback on activities have been automated to provide you with the ability to work at a pace appropriate to you as you complete your learning. The learning activities are designed to give you formative feedback throughout the course while summative assessments are used to provide you with information about your knowledge and to collect completion data for the course.If you do need to talk to a human, please reach out to our Customer Care Center.

SCECH Information

If you hold a Michigan teaching or administration certificate, this course offers five State Continuing Education Clock Hours (SCECHs) that you can earn. It satisfies the required hours for career consultation specific to exploration of military careers. To earn this credit, you must complete all of the assigned activities and spend the equivalent of the allocated SCECH credit as you work your way through this course. You can monitor your own progress by using the "Class Progress" and "Grades" links in the course navigation bar. Visit the Professional Learning Portal SCECH Courses page opens in new window for further information.

In order to complete this course, you must complete all of the assigned activities. You can monitor your progress by using the "Class Progress" and "Grades" links in the course navigation bar.
